Recommended Treatment: Per NCCN guidelines for stage III–IV uterine serous carcinoma: platinum-taxane–based systemic chemotherapy (eg, carboplatin/paclitaxel) with consideration of adjuvant external beam pelvic radiation therapy and vaginal brachytherapy.
Description: Surgical pathology demonstrates high-grade uterine papillary serous carcinoma with full-thickness myometrial and serosal invasion, extensive lymphovascular space invasion, cervical stromal involvement, and omental metastases consistent with stage IVB disease.
Patient Notes: Your report shows a high-grade uterine cancer called serous carcinoma that has spread beyond the uterus to the tissue lining your abdomen (omentum). You have already had surgery to remove the uterus, fallopian tubes, and ovaries. The next step is treatment with chemotherapy (a combination of carboplatin and paclitaxel), and radiation therapy may also be recommended to lower the chance of the cancer coming back.

verification.assessment: The extracted information accurately reflects the elements of the pathology report and is consistent with NCCN guideline–based treatment recommendations.
